bibl.title: Shifting Conceptions of the Divine: Sarapis as Part of Ptolemaic Egypt's Social Imaginaries.
bibl.note: Glimpses of Sarapian Prehistory: Egyptian Origins, Greek Innovations and New Systems of Meanings. - The First Ptolemies and the Integration of Sarapis into Egypt's Social Imaginaries. - The Construction of Religious Social Imaginary as Interaction. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Shifting Social Imaginaries in the Hellenistic Period. Narrations, Practices, and Images

bibl.seg: Eleni Fassa, Shifting Conceptions of the Divine: Sarapis as Part of Ptolemaic Egypt's Social Imaginaries.
Eftychia Stavrianopoulou (ed.), Shifting Social Imaginaries in the Hellenistic Period. Narrations, Practices, and Images = Mnemosyne. Supplementum 363 (Leiden, 2013) pp. 115-139.

Glimpses of Sarapian Prehistory: Egyptian Origins, Greek Innovations and New Systems of Meanings. - The First Ptolemies and the Integration of Sarapis into Egypt's Social Imaginaries. - The Construction of Religious Social Imaginary as Interaction. - Conclusion.
